text: Innovation is key to achieving sustainability goals.
Challenges such as decarbonization of operations
to water conservation are addressed through technologies
that drive sustainable transformation.
AWS enables customers
to build sustainability solutions ranging from carbon
tracking to energy conservation, to waste reduction.
Using AWS services to ingest, analyze,
and manage sustainability data.
AWS offers a broad
and deep set of capabilities in artificial intelligence,
machine learning, internet of things, data analytics
and computing to reach your
organization's sustainability goals.
With a growing number of data sources
for tracking the environmental impact of your organization,
it becomes challenging to discover, assess validity,
and extract values from these assets across multiple teams.
The Guidance for Sustainability Data Management on AWS
provides a streamlined framework
for enterprise data management.
When it comes to data, this guidance takes quality,
security, cataloging
and lineage into consideration, allowing you
to seamlessly share applicable data sets.
With more reliable data,
organizations can solve use cases such
as more accurately calculating their estimated carbon
emissions, assessing climate risk,
or understanding the biodiversity
impact of the organization.
With centralized access to key data assets,
you can extract insights using generative AI
and make informed decisions
to achieve your environmental goals more efficiently
with proper data governance.
Leaders in manufacturing
and industrial organizations need
to optimize their energy consumption
to lower both their costs and their carbon footprint,
but many lack the tools they need
to identify savings opportunities, prioritize interventions,
or measure and verify performance. By using energy
use optimization solutions on AWS, organizations can track
energy use and their carbon footprint,
implement targeted efficiency measures,
and reduce overall energy
and emissions while driving sustainable cost reductions.
The Guidance for Monitoring
and Optimizing Energy Usage on AWS demonstrates how
to monitor and optimize the energy use of industrial and/
or building equipment in customer premises
using AI/ML on AWS. From data ingestion to data processing
and model training to inference,
customers can use this guidance to maximize their energy
consumption while driving energy cost reduction.
Physical climate risk assessment,
PCRA, provides critical insights into the expected impacts
of climate change on businesses,
organizations, and communities.
Understanding the potential risks
and consequences of climate change empowers decision makers
to create and implement effective strategies
for adaptation and resilience.
The Guidance for Physical Climate Risk Assessment on AWS
provides a technical foundation to visualize
and monitor key performance indicators, KPIs
for reporting on climate related physical
risks to your operations.
In particular, it demonstrates
how you can enrich physical assets using large scale,
high quality climate projection data sets made available
through the Amazon sustainability data initiative.
Visit the AWS Solutions Library
to view more guidance resources on
how cloud technology can help accelerate your sustainability
transformation.
